children.markdown:
Grabbed on my Flip Mino HD, edited in the flip software:

<object height="293" width="520"><param name="allowfullscreen" value="true"></param><param name="allowscriptaccess" value="always"></param><param name="movie" value="http://vimeo.com/moogaloop.swf?clip_id=4428296&server=vimeo.com&show_title=1&show_byline=1&show_portrait=1&color=ffffff&fullscreen=1"></param><embed allowfullscreen="true" allowscriptaccess="always" height="293" src="http://vimeo.com/moogaloop.swf?clip_id=4428296&server=vimeo.com&show_title=1&show_byline=1&show_portrait=1&color=ffffff&fullscreen=1" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" width="520"></embed></object>[London May Day Protests 2009](http://vimeo.com/4428296) from [Adam Tinworth](http://vimeo.com/adders) on [Vimeo](http://vimeo.com/).

If I’d had my MacBook with me, I’d still have used iMovie and edited it much more tightly. Trimming clips isn’t that easy in the Flip’s own software. But in terms of getting good stuff up quickly, the Flip hits the spot…
